medical_history.history_of_present_illness: In 1995, the patient's symptoms began when his wife noted he stopped breathing at night. He occasionally awoke with palpitations. After a sleep study showing an AHI of 36 per hour, he used CPAP initially, which improved his symptoms, but he later discontinued due to discomfort and lifestyle interference. Currently, he states he feels well, falls asleep easily, and sleeps about 8 hours per night without shortness of breath or daytime sleepiness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Coronary artery disease (with stent placement), hypertension, hyperlipidemia, diverticulitis, recurrent sinusitis, and L5-S1 radiculopathy.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lives in a suburb of Boston with his wife and two children, owns a small company, and does not smoke or drink regularly.
